body.challenges: this was my first solo, large(ish)-scale project and presented me with many challenges regarding manipulation of data, working with a database (albeit merely a local json file), and much more.
body.learned: the model/view/controller (mvc) architechture kept me organized and made maneuvering my way through the data much easier than i though it would have otherwise been. the course i took through udemy really came into play as i took a similar approach to the architecture.

body.challenges: this was one of the final projects in jonas schmedtmann's javascript course, and the largest in scale, and presented me with many challenges along the way that i, as a new developer, had not experienced yet.
body.learned: this project was the point at which i finally understood that javascript is not just for aesthetics, but rather mostly for data management and manipulation. after this project, i had a new image of javascript and have progessed in a whole new way ever since.
